title: Athletism — Skiing (Elite) — Phase 8: Specificity — GS/SL Modeling
equipment: Gym: squat rack, platforms, barbells, dumbbells, cables
Stationary bike/Wattbike, treadmill (incline), curved sprint track
goal: Simulate course demands: starts, rhythm changes, long vs short turns.

warmup: Activation 8–10' (glute med, deep core, scapular control)
Landing mechanics: snap-downs, pogos, lateral snap-downs
main: On‑snow (if available): 4–6 sections (8–15 gates) @90–95% with full recovery
Dryland model: curved sprints 6x60m + cone rhythm changes
Strength (power): 3x2 Trap Bar Jump + MB rotational throws 4x6/side

notes: Week 1: Broken runs (sections). Week 2: Full‑run simulations with timing where possible.
